content:
TextElementCollection<TextElementType> Class

Definition

Provides standard facilities for creating and managing a type-safe, ordered collection of TextElement objects. This is a generic collection for working with objects of a specified type that derives from TextElement.

In this Article

public class TextElementCollection<TextElementType> : System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<TextElementType>, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<TextElementType>, System.Collections.IList where TextElementType : TextElement

Type Parameters

TextElementType

Type specifier for the generic collection. Acceptable types are constrained to a type of TextElement or a descendant of TextElement.
Inheritance
System.Object
TextElementCollection<TextElementType>

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

This collection supports zero-based indexing.

Properties

Count

Gets the number of items currently in the collection.

public int Count { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of items currently in the collection.

IsReadOnly

Gets a value that indicates whether or not the collection is read-only.

public bool IsReadOnly { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the collection is read-only; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Currently, this property always returns false.

Methods

Add(TextElementType)

Appends a specified item to the collection.

public void Add (TextElementType item);
item
TextElementType

An item to append to the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

Raised when item already belongs to a collection.

ArgumentNullException

Raised when item is null.

AddRange(IEnumerable)

Appends a specified range of items to the collection.

public void AddRange (System.Collections.IEnumerable range);
range
IEnumerable

An object that implements the IEnumerable interface, and that specifies a range of items to add to the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

Raised when range includes any null items.

ArgumentNullException

Raised when range is null.

Clear()

Clears all items from the collection.

public void Clear ();

Contains(TextElementType)

Queries for the presence of a specified item in the collection.

public bool Contains (TextElementType item);
item
TextElementType

An item to query for the presence of in the collection.

Returns
Boolean

true if the specified item is present in the collection; otherwise, false.

CopyTo(TextElementType[],Int32)

Copies the contents of the collection and inserts them into a specified array starting at a specified index position in the array.

public void CopyTo (TextElementType[] array, int arrayIndex);
array
TextElementType[][]

A one-dimensional array to which the collection contents will be copied. This array must use zero-based indexing.

arrayIndex
Int32

A zero-based index in array specifying the position at which to begin inserting the copied collection objects.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

Raised when array includes items that are not compatible with the type TextElement, or if arrayIndex specifies a position that falls outside of the bounds of array.

ArgumentNullException

Raised when array is null.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

Raised when arrayIndex is less than 0.

GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator for the contents of the collection.

public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator<TextElementType> GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator<TextElementType>

An enumerator for the contents of the collection.

InsertAfter(TextElementType,TextElementType)

Inserts a specified item in the collection after a specified collection item.

public void InsertAfter (TextElementType previousSibling, TextElementType newItem);
previousSibling
TextElementType

An item in the collection after which the new item will be inserted.

newItem
TextElementType

An item to insert into the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

Raised when newItem already belongs to a collection.

ArgumentNullException

Raised when previousSibling or newItem is null.

InvalidOperationException

Raised when previousSibling does not belong to this collection.

InsertBefore(TextElementType,TextElementType)

Inserts a specified item in the collection before a specified collection item.

public void InsertBefore (TextElementType nextSibling, TextElementType newItem);
nextSibling
TextElementType

An item in the collection before which the new item will be inserted.

newItem
TextElementType

An item to insert into the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

Raised when newItem already belongs to a collection.

ArgumentNullException

Raised when nextSibling or newItem is null.

InvalidOperationException

Raised when nextSibling does not belong to this collection.

Remove(TextElementType)

Removes a specified item from the collection.

public bool Remove (TextElementType item);
item
TextElementType

An item to be removed fro the collection.

Returns
Boolean

true if the specified item was found and removed; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This method returns false if item is null.

Explicit Interface Implementations

ICollection.CopyTo(Array,Int32)

Copies the elements of the ICollection to an Array, starting at a particular Array index.. Use the type-safe stem.Windows.Documents.TextElementCollection`1.CopyTo* method instead.

void ICollection.CopyTo (Array array, int arrayIndex);
array
Array

The one-dimensional Array that is the destination of the elements copied from ICollection. The Array must have zero-based indexing.

arrayIndex
Int32

The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

ICollection.Count

Gets the number of elements contained in the ICollection. Use the type-safe stem.Windows.Documents.TextElementCollection`1.Count* property instead.

int System.Collections.ICollection.Count { get; }
Returns
Int32

The number of elements contained in the ICollection.

ICollection.IsSynchronized

Gets a value indicating whether access to the ICollection is synchronized (thread safe).

bool System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if access to the ICollection is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, false.

ICollection.SyncRoot

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the ICollection.

object System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot { get; }
Returns
System.Object

An object that can be used to synchronize access to the ICollection.

IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that iterates through a collection. Use the type-safe stem.Windows.Documents.TextElementCollection`1.GetEnumerator* method instead.

System.Collections.IEnumerator IEnumerable.GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator

An IEnumerator object that can be used to iterate through the collection.

IList.Add(Object)

Adds an item to the IList. Use the type-safe stem.Windows.Documents.TextElementCollection`1.Add* method instead.

int IList.Add (object value);
value
System.Object

The object to add to the IList.

Returns
Int32

The position into which the new element was inserted.

IList.Clear()

This type or member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. Use the type-safe stem.Windows.Documents.TextElementCollection`1.Clear* method instead.

void IList.Clear ();

IList.Contains(Object)

Determines whether the IList contains a specific value.. Use the type-safe stem.Windows.Documents.TextElementCollection`1.Contains* method instead.

bool IList.Contains (object value);
value
System.Object

The object to locate in the IList.

Returns
Boolean

true if the Object is found in the IList; otherwise, false.

IList.IndexOf(Object)

Determines the index of a specific item in the IList.

int IList.IndexOf (object value);
value
System.Object

The object to locate in the IList.

Returns
Int32

The index of value if found in the list; otherwise, -1.

IList.Insert(Int32,Object)

Inserts an item to the IList at the specified index. Use the type-safe stem.Windows.Documents.TextElementCollection`1.InsertAfter* or stem.Windows.Documents.TextElementCollection`1.InsertBefore* methods instead.

void IList.Insert (int index, object value);
index
Int32

The zero-based index at which value should be inserted.

value
System.Object

The object to insert into the IList.

IList.IsFixedSize

Gets a value indicating whether the IList has a fixed size.

bool System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if the IList has a fixed size; otherwise, false.

IList.IsReadOnly

Gets a value indicating whether the IList is read-only.

bool System.Collections.IList.IsReadOnly { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if the IList is read-only; otherwise, false.

IList.Item(Int32)

Gets or sets the element at the specified index.

object System.Collections.IList.Item[int index] { get; set; }
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the element to get or set.

Returns
System.Object

The element at the specified index.

IList.Remove(Object)

Removes the first occurrence of a specific object from the IList. Use the type-safe stem.Windows.Documents.TextElementCollection`1.Remove* method instead.

void IList.Remove (object value);
value
System.Object

The object to remove from the IList.

IList.RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the IList item at the specified index.

void IList.RemoveAt (int index);
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the item to remove.
